method.name: Fuzzy Rule Learning, Grammar-GP based operators and Simulated Annealing-based algorithm

reference.ref: L. Sánchez and I. Couso. Combining GP Operators With SA Search To Evolve Fuzzy Rule Based Classifiers. Information Sciences 136:(1-4) (2001) 175-192.

generalDescription.objective: To obtain fuzzy classifiers by means of learning fuzzy rule throught Simulated Annealing algorithms with genetic operators.
generalDescription.howWork:
A Simulated Annealing algorithm is used to learn a fuzzy classifier. For each hypothesis, the number of labels and number of rules must be given. In same way, as it is possible to manage any combination of conjuntion and/or disjuntions in the antecedent part of a fuzzy rule, a maximum deep tree size must be given too.
Those parameters are, in conjuntion with Simulated Annealing typical parameters, of capital importance in the evolution of this method.

parameterSpec.param: numlabes: the number of possible fuzzy values for each variable.
numrules: the number of rules for each classifier.
p0sap:initial probability to accept a worse than current individial, SAP parameter.
p1sap: final probability to accept a worse than current individual, SAP parameter.
numitera: number of iterations to reach the objectives, SAP parameter.
amplmuta : the maximum bias that a mutation operation can introduce. SAP Parameter.
nsubsap: number of suppopulations in the SAP algorithm.
proboptimlocal: indicates the probability to improve SAP with local search SAP parameter.
numoptimlocal: the number of local search steps, SAP parameter.
idoptimlocal: the local search method used, SAP parameter.
probcrossga: probability of genetic algorithm (parametric) operations to take place, SAP parameter.
probmutaga: probability of genetic algorithm (structural) operations to take place, SAP parameter.
lenchaingap: length of SAP chain, genetic parameter.
maxtreeheight: maximum deep of a fuzzy tree.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Clas-Fuzzy-SAP Dataset: iris Training set: iris-10-1tra.dat Test set: iris-10-1tst.dat Test Show results: StatChekCL Parameters: numlabels = 3 numrules = 10 outlabel = CFSAP deltafitsap = 0.5 p0sap = 0.5 p1sap = 0.001 amplmuta = 0.1 nsubsap = 100 proboptimlocal = 0.00 numoptimlocal = 0 idoptimlocal = 0 probcrossga = 0.5 probmutaga = 0.5 lenchaingap = 10 maxtreeheight = 10 numitera = 10000 After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/StatCheckCL/TSTClas-Fuzzy-SAP folder the classification results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= iris_plants_database Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.8666666666666667 N/C=0.0 ... Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.04666666666666666 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.052068331172711035 Correctly classified: 0.9533333333333334 Global N/C: 0.0
TRAIN RESULTS ============ Classifier= iris_plants_database Summary of data, Classifiers: iris_plants_database Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9851851851851852 N/C=0.0 ... Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.021481481481481483 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.003989010968247764 Correctly classified: 0.9785185185185186 Global N/C: 0.0
We can see too the output and target classes for each case of the train set (result0s0.tra) in experiment/results/Clas-Fuzzy-SAP/iris/:
@relation Iris_Plants_Database @attribute sepalLength real[4.3,7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real[2.0,4.4] @attribute petalLength real[1.0,6.9] @attribute petalWidth real[0.1,2.5] @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa ...
And the test results (result0s0.tst) in experiment/results/Clas-Fuzzy-SAP/iris/:
@relation Iris_Plants_Database @attribute sepalLength real[4.3,7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real[2.0,4.4] @attribute petalLength real[1.0,6.9] @attribute petalWidth real[0.1,2.5] @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-versicolor Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-versicolor
